column1: ap 01:00|one|"In the absence of a more violent form of ordeal stemming from the teachers
column2: the older pupils frequently take over the role of ‘tribal elders’ and administer their own tortures on ‘new boys’. These vary from place to place. At one school
column5: having bundles of grasses stuffed inside their clothing. At another they are ‘stoned’
column6: being bent over a large stone and spanked. At another they are forced to run down a long corridor lined with older pupils who kick them as they pass. At yet another they are ‘bumped’
column7: being held by arms and legs and banged on the ground as many times as their age in years. Alternatively on the day a new pupil wears his first school uniform
column8: he may have his flesh pinched once for each new article of clothing
column9: by each senior pupil. In rare cases
column10: the ordeal is much more elaborate and may almost approach a full-scale tribal initiation ceremony. Even today
column11: occasional deaths are reported as a result of these activities."|"The Human Zoo"|"Desmond Morris"
